item.title: Cloud Sizing
item.description: Some days ago, based on a question from a customer and as a way to “dust off” my python skills, i started writing a quick script/tool that fetches the assigned public ips from the major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and converts it to other formats ready to be pushed to network infrastructure (Firewalls, ACLs, LBs, Routers, BGP injection, etc). While doing this, and inspired from a “100M AWS IPv4 addressess” number, researched by Andre Toonk that i read in another blog, i got inspired to check the current status of the IPv4 usage on the cloud providers, and compare their size based on the amount of addresses assigned to their services.
